doc.after: It may be possible to exploit RNA interference in therapy Although it is difficult to introduce long dsRNA strands into mammalian cells due to the interferon response the use of short interfering RNA has been more successful 112 Among the first applications to reach clinical trials were in the treatment of macular degeneration and respiratory syncytial virus 113 RNAi has also been shown to be effective in reversing induced liver failure in mouse models 114
